commands.name: trigger.model.pause()
commands.description: This function pauses a running trigger model.
commands.details: This command pauses the trigger model.To continue the trigger model, send the resume command.

param_info.name: reset()dmm.measure.func = dmm.FUNC_DC_VOLTAGEtrigger.model.setblock(1, trigger.BLOCK_BUFFER_CLEAR, defbuffer1)trigger.model.setblock(2, trigger.BLOCK_DELAY_CONSTANT, 0)trigger.model.setblock(3, trigger.BLOCK_MEASURE_DIGITIZE, defbuffer1, trigger.COUNT_INFINITE)trigger.model.setblock(4, trigger.BLOCK_WAIT, trigger.EVENT_DISPLAY)trigger.model.setblock(5, trigger.BLOCK_MEASURE_DIGITIZE, defbuffer1, trigger.COUNT_STOP)trigger.model.setblock(6, trigger.BLOCK_NOTIFY, trigger.EVENT_NOTIFY1)trigger.model.initiate()trigger.model.pause()delay(10)trigger.model.resume()waitcomplete()print(defbuffer1.n)
Set up a trigger model, then run it, pause for delay of 10 seconds, then resume it.

examples.example: reset();dmm.measure.func = dmm.FUNC_DC_VOLTAGE;trigger.model.setblock(1, trigger.BLOCK_BUFFER_CLEAR, defbuffer1);trigger.model.setblock(2, trigger.BLOCK_DELAY_CONSTANT, 0);trigger.model.setblock(3, trigger.BLOCK_MEASURE_DIGITIZE, defbuffer1, trigger.COUNT_INFINITE);trigger.model.setblock(4, trigger.BLOCK_WAIT, trigger.EVENT_DISPLAY);trigger.model.setblock(5, trigger.BLOCK_MEASURE_DIGITIZE, defbuffer1, trigger.COUNT_STOP);trigger.model.setblock(6, trigger.BLOCK_NOTIFY, trigger.EVENT_NOTIFY1);trigger.model.initiate();trigger.model.pause();delay(10);trigger.model.resume();waitcomplete();print(defbuffer1.n);
examples.description: Set up a trigger model, then run it, pause for delay of 10 seconds, then resume it.

commands.name: trigger.model.resume()
commands.description: This function continues a paused trigger model.
commands.details: This command continues running the trigger model operation if the trigger model was paused.

param_info.name: reset()dmm.measure.func = dmm.FUNC_DC_VOLTAGEtrigger.model.setblock(1, trigger.BLOCK_BUFFER_CLEAR, defbuffer1)trigger.model.setblock(2, trigger.BLOCK_DELAY_CONSTANT, 0)trigger.model.setblock(3, trigger.BLOCK_MEASURE_DIGITIZE, defbuffer1, trigger.COUNT_INFINITE)trigger.model.setblock(4, trigger.BLOCK_WAIT, trigger.EVENT_DISPLAY)trigger.model.setblock(5, trigger.BLOCK_MEASURE_DIGITIZE, defbuffer1, trigger.COUNT_STOP)trigger.model.setblock(6, trigger.BLOCK_NOTIFY, trigger.EVENT_NOTIFY1)trigger.model.initiate()trigger.model.pause()delay(10)trigger.model.resume()waitcomplete()print(defbuffer1.n)
Set up a trigger model, then run it, pause for delay of 10 seconds, then resume it.

examples.example: reset();dmm.measure.func = dmm.FUNC_DC_VOLTAGE;trigger.model.setblock(1, trigger.BLOCK_BUFFER_CLEAR, defbuffer1);trigger.model.setblock(2, trigger.BLOCK_DELAY_CONSTANT, 0);trigger.model.setblock(3, trigger.BLOCK_MEASURE_DIGITIZE, defbuffer1, trigger.COUNT_INFINITE);trigger.model.setblock(4, trigger.BLOCK_WAIT, trigger.EVENT_DISPLAY);trigger.model.setblock(5, trigger.BLOCK_MEASURE_DIGITIZE, defbuffer1, trigger.COUNT_STOP);trigger.model.setblock(6, trigger.BLOCK_NOTIFY, trigger.EVENT_NOTIFY1);trigger.model.initiate();trigger.model.pause();delay(10);trigger.model.resume();waitcomplete();print(defbuffer1.n);
examples.description: Set up a trigger model, then run it, pause for delay of 10 seconds, then resume it.

commands.name: buffer.math()
commands.signature: buffer.math(readingBuffer, unit, EXPR_POLY, constant0, constant1, constant2, constant3, constant4, constant5)
commands.description: This function allows you to run a mathematical expression on a measurement. The expression is applied when the measurement is placed in the reading buffer.

param_info.name: readingBuffer
param_info.description: The name of the reading buffer; the reading buffer selected must be set to the style FULL

param_info.name: unit
param_info.description: The units to be applied to the value generated by the expression
param_info.enum: buffer.UNIT_CUSTOM3 nil|buffer.UNIT_DBM nil|buffer.UNIT_CUSTOM2 nil|buffer.UNIT_FAHRENHEIT nil|buffer.UNIT_SECOND nil|buffer.UNIT_RATIO nil|buffer.UNIT_DIO nil|buffer.UNIT_AMP_AC nil|buffer.UNIT_OHM nil|buffer.UNIT_NONE nil|buffer.UNIT_AMP nil|buffer.UNIT_PERCENT nil|buffer.UNIT_VOLT nil|buffer.UNIT_KELVIN nil|buffer.UNIT_CUSTOM1 nil|buffer.UNIT_CELSIUS nil|buffer.UNIT_TOT nil|buffer.UNIT_DAC nil|buffer.UNIT_DECIBEL nil|buffer.UNIT_VOLT_AC nil|buffer.UNIT_FARAD nil|buffer.UNIT_HERTZ nil|buffer.UNIT_RECIPROCAL nil|buffer.UNIT_WATT nil|buffer.UNIT_X nil

param_info.name: constant0
param_info.description: The constant to be used for c0 in the expression

param_info.name: constant1
param_info.description: The constant to be used for c1 in the expression

param_info.name: constant2
param_info.description: The constant to be used for c2 in the expression

param_info.name: constant3
param_info.description: The constant to be used for c3 in the expression

param_info.name: constant4
param_info.description: The constant to be used for c4 in the expression

param_info.name: constant5
param_info.description: The constant to be used for c5 in the expression

usage: buffer.math(readingBuffer, unit, EXPR_POLY, constant0, constant1, constant2, constant3, constant4, constant5)

examples.example: reset();mathExp = buffer.make(200, buffer.STYLE_FULL);dmm.measure.func = dmm.FUNC_DC_VOLTAGE; ;buffer.math(mathExp, buffer.UNIT_NONE, buffer.EXPR_MULTIPLY);for x = 1, 3 do ;     print("Reading: ", dmm.measure.read(mathExp));end; ;display.changescreen(display.SCREEN_READING_TABLE); ;print("Extra value reading 1: ", mathExp.extravalues[1]);print("Extra value reading 2: ", mathExp.extravalues[2]);print("Extra value reading 3: ", mathExp.extravalues[3]);
examples.description:
Reset the instrument.
--- --Make a buffer named mathExp set to hold 200 readings with a buffer style of FULL.
--- --Set the measure function to DC voltage.
--- --Set the buffer math expression to multiply readings against the previous readings.
--- --Make three readings.
--- --Display the reading table on the front panel of the instrument, where you can view the extra readings.
--- --Print the extra values (the calculated values).
--- --Example output:
--- --Reading: 6.3863430578e-05
--- --Reading: 6.7818055872e-05
--- --Reading: 1.9871571784e-05
--- --Extra value reading 1: 6.3863430578e-05
--- --Extra value reading 2: 4.3310937031e-09
--- --Extra value reading 3: 1.3476513655e-09

commands.name: buffer.unit()
commands.description: This function allows you to create up to three custom units of measure for use in buffers.
commands.details: You can use custom units of measures in buffer math and writable buffers.If you specify more than two characters, the additional characters are ignored. Some characters are converted to other symbols:This unit is reset when power is cycled. It is not affected by reset.

param_info.name: UNIT_CUSTOMN
param_info.description: Custom unit user can create, The number of the custom unit, 1, 2, or 3

param_info.name: N
param_info.description: The number of the custom unit, 1, 2, or 3

param_info.name: unitOfMeasure
param_info.description: A string that defines the custom unit; up to three characters; defaults are X for custom unit 1, Y for unit 2, and Z for unit 3

examples.example: reset();mathExp = buffer.make(200, buffer.STYLE_FULL);dmm.measure.func = dmm.FUNC_DC_VOLTAGE;buffer.unit(buffer.UNIT_CUSTOM1, "fb") ; ;buffer.math(mathExp, buffer.UNIT_CUSTOM1, buffer.EXPR_MULTIPLY);for x = 1, 3 do ;     print("Reading "..x..":", dmm.measure.read(mathExp));end; ;display.changescreen(display.SCREEN_READING_TABLE);for x = 1, 3 do ;     print("Extra value reading "..x..":", mathExp.extravalues[x]);end;

Reset the instrument.

commands.name: dmm.measure.dbmreference
commands.description: This attribute defines the decibel-milliwatts (dBm) reference.
commands.details: This value only applied when the unit setting for the function is set to dBm.

param_info.name: value
param_info.description: The dBm impedance value (1 Ω to 9999 Ω)

param_info.name: function
param_info.description: See Functions

examples.description: Sets the units to dBm and sets the dBm reference to 85 Ω.

commands.name: dmm.digitize.dbmreference
commands.description: This attribute defines the decibel-milliwatts (dBm) reference.
commands.details: This value only applied when the unit setting for the function is set to dBm.

param_info.name: value
param_info.description: The dBm reference value (1 Ω to 9999 Ω)

examples.description: Sets the units to dBm and sets the dBm resistance to 85 Ω.

commands.name: display.activebuffer
commands.description: This attribute determines which buffer is used for measurements that are displayed on the front panel.
commands.details: The buffer defined by this command is used to store measurements data and is shown in the reading buffer indicator on the home screen of the instrument.

param_info.name: bufferName
param_info.description: The name of the buffer to make active

examples.description: Set the front panel to use buffer2 as the active reading buffer.

commands.name: trigger.continuous
commands.description: This attribute determines the trigger mode setting after bootup.
commands.details: Conditions must be valid before continuous measurements can start.When the restart parameter is selected, the instrument is placed in local mode, aborts any running scripts, and aborts any trigger models that are running. If the command is in a script, it is the last command that runs before the script is aborted. The restart parameter is not stored in nonvolatile memory, so it does not affect start up behavior.The off and automatic parameters are stored in nonvolatile memory, so they affect start up behavior.

param_info.name: setting
param_info.description: Do not start continuous measurements after boot

examples.description: When the instrument starts up, the measurement method is set to idle.

commands.name: available()
commands.description: This function checks for the presence of specific instrument functionality.

param_info.name: presence
param_info.description: If the functionality is present, returns true; if not, returns false

param_info.name: functionality
param_info.description: The functionality to check for

examples.description: Returns true if GPIB communications are available. Returns false if GPIB communications are not available.

commands.name: dmm.measure.getattribute()
commands.description: This function returns the setting for a function attribute.
commands.details: The options for function are shown in the following table.You can retrieve one attribute at a time.

param_info.name: value
param_info.description: The attribute value

param_info.name: function
param_info.description: The measurement function; see Details

param_info.name: setting
param_info.description: The attribute for the function; refer to dmm.measure.setattribute() for available settings

examples.description:
Retrieve the range, NPLC, and digits settings for the DC voltage function.
--- --Example return:
--- --0.02
--- --1
--- --dmm.DIGITS_4_5

Configure the DC Current function settings for the range, display resolution, and number of power line cycles (NPLCs) whether or not DC Current is the active function.

--- --Save the settings into measlist.

commands.name: dmm.measure.configlist.storefunc()
commands.description: This function allows you to store the settings for a measure function into a measure configuration list whether or not the function is active.
commands.details: You must create the configuration list before using this command.If index is not specified, the settings are stored to the next available index in the configuration list.You can set function to the values in the following table.

param_info.name: listName
param_info.description: Name of the configuration list in which to store the function settings

param_info.name: function
param_info.description: The measure function settings to save into the configuration list; see Details

param_info.name: index
param_info.description: The number of the configuration list index in which to store the settings

examples.description:
Create a measure configuration list named MyMeasList.
--- --Store the attributes for the DC Voltage settings in index 1.
--- --Stores attributes for the Temperature function in index 2.
